column4: you need to install it with aptitude, you may have the wrong version
: I'm following the instructions found here : https://help.ubuntu.com/community/AMD64/FirefoxAndPlugins
in my experience that is pretty hard. you may need to do a lot of troubleshooting. flock installed easily for me
: well this isn't the only time I haven't been able to extract a tar file. I can't extract any, and I always get the same error message. I'm probably just doing something wrong.
tar -xvzf?
: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/51743/
:  from the command: tar -zxf firefox-2.0.0.7.tar.gz
try what I showed you
you need -xvf for .tar, -xzvf for tar.gz, and -xjf for tar.bz2
cd to where the file is. by default, that would be cd ~/Desktop
it extracts to the same directory that the archive is in
: so it should be in my home folder?
it should be on your desktop
:  it's not
you should have a firefox folder there
: I don't
what directory was the file in when you extracted it?

: here's what it extracting in terminal : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/51744/ I did in fact find a firefox folder in my home folder, says it was last modified in november. I don't remember putting it there, and I'm not sure if my extracting would have counted as a modification/that was when this version was released.
: that's the folder, but I don't know how to move it into the next folder. the next command I'm supposed to input is sudo mv firefox /usr/local/firefox32
that command should work if you are in home and firefox folder is there as you said
: the folder is in home and I get the error mv: cannot stat `firefox': No such file or directory
: using the command sudo mv firefox /usr/local/firefox32
